abstract.text: A container that encapsulates the Core Data stack in your app.

inlineContent.text: NSPersistentContainer simplifies the creation and management of the Core Data stack by handling the creation of the managed object model (

abstract.text: Persist or cache data on a single device, or sync data to multiple devices with CloudKit.
An object space to manipulate and track changes to managed objects.
A programmatic representation of the
file describing your objects.
A container that encapsulates the Core Data stack in your app, and mirrors select persistent stores to a CloudKit private database.
A container that encapsulates the Core Data stack in your app.
Returns the location of the directory that contains the persistent stores.
The location of the directory that contains the persistent stores.
Creates a container with the specified name.
Create a container with the specified name and managed object model.
Loads the persistent stores.
The container’s managed object model.
The container’s name.
Returns a new managed object context that executes on a private queue.
Executes a closure on a private queue using an ephemeral managed object context.
Initializes a new persistent container using the provided name for the container.
Initializes a new persistent container using the provided name and managed object model.
The container’s persistent store coordinator.
The descriptions of the container’s persistent stores.
The main queue’s managed object context.
An object that enables an app’s contexts and the underlying persistent stores to work together.
Set up the classes that manage and persist your app’s objects.

abstract.text: Create the individual components that Core Data requires manually, to support earlier versions of Apple operating systems.

abstract.text: Set up the classes and capabilities that sync your store to CloudKit.

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
